title: Why i feel Zoe was a wasted effort
body:
Just my opinion here, really just expressing my thoughts on Zoe.

1) She's just really bland. Shes basically a pretween girl with alot of flashy lights. She's a Targonian? This is what Aurilion Sol was afraid of? Pfftf.
2) her kit is alright, but given the difficulty of trying to play pong mid-combat, there's no real benefit to bouncing her shot, it literally does no extra damage. Alot of extra trouble for basically nothing
3) her ability to use copies of summoner spells i feel is a little OP 
4)ANOTHER "human-looking" champion in the game. Yay cuz we all wanna be humans playing humans in a game right? 
5) it feels oddly repulsive and somewhat discomforting that a young girl charachter that obviously looks like an underaged girl enters this combat on the rift and fights to the death
6)she feels like a project that spent 1 day in the art department and about 20 minutes in development before release. Lack of depth in everything, kit, lore, gameplay

just some complaints i wanted to vent that nobody has to listen to

gg

I must agree, no matter how sad it makes me feel. I do not blame Riot for Zoe's weird situation though, because I'm so glad to see that they finally started thinking outside of their comfort zone (and by that I mean tanks  and supports). Finally there is something different in the mid lane (not just Syndra pressing Qs for an eternity then pressing R or Yasuo and Zed abusing you because they are Riot's favorite champions), and this difference is in the kit of a burst mage and not a tank or a support. Riot tends to fill their new champions with unique kits when there is no big risk that the champion will be useless. For example, giving Ornn the passive that lets him buy items anywhere and (almost) anytime on the map is not risky because if the passive gets useless, it is not a big deal at all since he is "just a tank". Rakan's passive is similar to this. No time to come up with a unique passive for a support? No problem, give him a periodic shield. No idea what Taliyah's passive should be? Give him a small amount of movement speed here and there. But Riot took a risky step towards more complex champions and this step was Zoe herself. The idea of her kit is perfect, it makes her feel unique and cool and fun. There are some balance problems with her being a little bit too weak though, and like many other burst mages, she is struggling against tanks. 
And there is her desing... I really do not like Zoe's preteen girly design, what's more, I simply hate it. I do not care if she is a demi-god or not, she looks like, talks like and acts like a child from elementary school. I want to play  the mightiest mages like Lissandra, the banished ice witch, legendary creatures like Tahm Kench, the demon king of the rivers, and dark, scary beings like Thresh, the collector of souls. Aaaaand there is Zoe, the little girl who jumps and hops around the lane, throwing bubbles with butterflies at her enemies and using random active items and summoner spells now and then. Ugh. Simply ugh.

No. Zoe, if using her powers optimally (which admittedly she does not do) can basically replicate anything Sol can. 

You want to destroy Void with starfire? Zoe can create a teleporting sunbeam laser with the potential energy of an atomic bomb. Trivially, really. 

You can open a Rift to a black hole. 

You can create a portal to the center of a planet and turn off gravity and watch as Runeterra literally spins itself to its own destruction. 

There is nothing to suggest she needs energy. Only that the Twilight parasite lets her do stuff with her power. The power is ridiculous and destructive. The most terrifying thing Riot has ever written. The scale of change that could be done with this power is staggering. Almost outside of human comprehension. 

Hell there’s a reason why most fictions have portals used very limited: must be shot out of a gun onto a specific surface. Must have both sides of the portal built meaning you have to travel to those locations physically before establishing these pathways. Limits on where you can put them. 

Zoe has none of these limits. 

She is just an idiot and uses them to play jump rope.

She's on the same level of ASol, not above him.

Main difference here being that ASol is enslaved, and Zoe is free. Also, she doesn't care because she's a kid. She doesn't want responsibility, of her actions or her power or anything else.

She can't create stars. Also, I don't think her portals can be large enough to fire a star through, nor would they last very long.

Here’s the thing Rioters said that Zoe is on the same level as Sol and gave some silly justification that Sol can kill things better than her. When that is blatantly not true if you think of creative ways on how to use portals.  

The fun thing is. She in theory can create stars with only the power set of gravity manipultion and portals. All you need is to form a dense enough matter of hydrogen which can be created through gravity manipulation on any large enough planet and then opening a portal to the center of a very hot nearby star. And done. Star. 

The thing is Sol’s power sounds amazingly impressive. Because it is. But he does 1 thing. While the powers of Zoe may sound less flashy on paper anyone with a cursory understanding of physics could think of ways of breaking the setting with them. 

But either because the writers don’t understand what they’ve created or didn’t fully analyze what 2 of her ridiculous powers could do if one tried to abuse them they think there is some parity there.

Or there could be limits.

Or y'know, logical physical laws are different in Runeterra, even when Zoe isn't around. Bit of a dumb excuse, but possible.

Except Sol himself references hydrogen, matter and atoms, and that the moon is a reflection of the sun which is a star. They’ve clearly given us dialogue pertaining to physics behaving like physics. 

This leads to limitations. Sure. Explain them then. Because an presented Zoe just turns off gravity. She just opens portals where she wants to go with the only restriction being whether Twilight wants her to go or not. 

If you’re making a magic system that actively effects the plot directly as Sol and Zoe clearly do. Then you don’t get to just hand wave limitations to explain things. That’s the worst form of fantasy. 

Point is, Zoe creates portals without needing to see where she’s going, without needing a platform or even solid foundation to put them on. And she can do it at a large enough range to traverse the galaxy maybe even the universe and even hop dimensions. Furthermore she apparently doesn’t need to breathe, or even land to walk on. 

She is so far beyond anything that Riot has thus far presented as a character that it is almost laughable to think anyone compares to her. 

Only she doesn’t even tap the potential of her abilities. 

Because she’s a moron.

By Riot, she is at Sol's level, so there's that.

However, I am not ignoring your points about limitations.  The sequence thus far presented do not show her getting tired at any time.  The artwork released with Zoe, specifically to give a reference to what type of power we're talking about here has her playing jump-rope with star powers and ensnaring Sol in a bunch of magic energy.  

You can find them here: http://www.lol-wallpapers.com/champions/zoe-official-artwork/

That's the official work for her.  That's her power.  I don't know how she does it, so I try to avoid talking about it directly.  My assumption is gravity wells strung out to create a pathway for light to follow.  But, that's only because I know she can affect gravity in some way and I'm trying not to give her new powers out of the blue.

But even if she can only create 1 portal (which she can't, in lore we see her create about 3 at the same time with no sign of effort) that alone is enough to make Sol's contributions fairly unnecessary.  Again, Starlight laser beam of doom.  It's awesome and only requires 1 portal.  She can at any time bring out a nuke.

Going forward if Zoe is expected to not have the solution for everything in her back pocket she does need limitations.  So far the only one explicitly given by Riot is that she's an idiot.  Because she is.  That's pretty much not arguable at this point.  She has no grasp on what the hell she's doing or what's going on and doesn't seem to understand cause and effect at a basic level that is frightening. 

But in terms of arguing about power, we don't get to make up evidence to suggest limitation when the writing and visuals give no such indication.  She may have a limit on how many portals she can have open at any time.  So far we know it's above 3, probably far above 3 because she has 3 open and still has the power to summon a meteor.  But to perform most of the meaningful tricks that make her so powerful only requires one or two.

Take, Twisted Fate and the Bilgewater event.  That explicitly gives the reader his limitations and power, it even becomes a plot point.  It's amazing, easily the best story Riot's written in my opinion.  Because it has rules, and the consequences of those rules allow the plot to flow from them.

The Aspects and Zoe, in particular, have no explained rules.  They just do things.  So if ever there comes a point where their abilities presented so far could quite easily solve the plot, then them not doing so makes them look like idiots.  The writers may then say that they couldn't because of some limitation or another.  But if that limitation is not expressed beforehand then it's just bad writing.

Common sense about energy transfer got shoved out the window as soon as stars were created by the inherent magical energy of a star dragon.  

In the story, Zoe opens several portals to teleport spears.  She clearly is also teleporting whatever clothes and items she's wearing, and since the first line is that she maintains momentum as she travels from one area to another clearly energy itself transfers through the portals.  So far death laser is still a go.

There is no talk about energy or even urgency with Zoe's creation of portals.  The only thing stopping her is that some outside force, likely Twilight itself, is causing her to remain in the area until her message is complete.  Which apparently happens when she blows up some guards.  

As to the artwork, Rioters commented that they added details to her art and design to give the players an idea of what kind of power she's working with.  She also comments in her lore that Sol does not like to be petted, but she can force him to be petted without accidentally harming him.  So she does some of that power in the artwork to at least get Sol to stay still, whether it's the magic chain or not.

You see now we come to the main difference between our understanding of the lore.  You're taking the notes from Sol's lore at face value and trying to match it to what power Zoe has shown.  So, in order to make them fit together, you have decided that she must be a lot weaker than her lore story makes her out to be, because otherwise, Sol's lore doesn't really make sense.  You are disregarding the quotes from Rioters that claim they are on even footing, to fit this notion.

That's all fair.

My point is, taking everything that is in Zoe's lore at face value, adding nothing, taking nothing away.  Then Sol's lore and Zoe's lore do not make sense together.  Zoe's power is ridiculous in scope and scale.  Her existence does make all those points you listed not make sense. I agree.  But the power as described by Rioters and as written in her story is what has created that rift. We don't get to fill it with our fanfiction to try and make the lore work.
